info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 07 at 3:58PM PDT by NWS Pendleton
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Morrow County through 430 PM PDT... At 358 PM PDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm capable of producing a landspout over Hardman, or 14 miles southwest of Heppner, moving northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Landspouts possible, winds in excess of 30 mph, and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Ruggs and Hardman. LANDSPOUT...POSSIBLE MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
